titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Collection on the Cuban Slave Trade MSS.569
titlestmt.author: Rachel Searcy

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-03-11 07:56:39 -0500.

did.unittitle: Collection on the Cuban Slave Trade
did.abstract: This collection consists of documents concerning slavery in Cuba between 1809 and 1898. Materials include telegrams, contracts, identification papers, travel licenses, marriage and baptism records, death and burial certificates, purchase and insurance documents, and manumission records documenting various aspects of slavery in Cuba, including the economics of the Atlantic slave trade, demographics of Cuban populations, England's abolition of slavery, the transportation of Chinese workers to Cuba, family relationships in the context of slavery, living and working conditions on sugar cane plantations, and manumission processes.
did.langmaterial: Materials are in primarily in Spanish, with some documents in English.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of documents concerning slavery in Cuba between 1809 and 1898. Materials include telegrams, contracts, identification papers, travel licenses, marriage and baptism records, death and burial certificates, purchase and insurance documents, and manumission records documenting various aspects of slavery in Cuba, including the economics of the Atlantic slave trade, demographics of Cuban populations, England's abolition of slavery, the transportation of Chinese workers to Cuba, family relationships in the context of slavery, living and working conditions on sugar cane plantations, and manumission processes.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Materials in this collection, which were created in 1809-1898 range, are in the public domain. Permission to publish or reproduce is not required.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Materials in this collection were purchased from a bookseller in 2017; original provenance is unknown. The accession number associated with this purchase is 2019.010.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; Collection on the Cuban Slave Trade; MSS 569; box number; folder number or item identifier; Fales Library and Special Collections, New York University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Documents with brittle paper were conserved to prevent immediate loss and documents with ink damage were housed in mylar with paper backing for additional support. Materials were described on the collection-level. The folder-level inventory was created by the collection's seller and modified by an archivist to remove deragatory terms and contextual details not relevant to the items.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials
separatedmaterial.p: Folder 1 in the inventory, a grouping of 80 documents concerning a case of five slaves at a sugar mill who killed a man they believed to be the Governor General of Cuba, was removed from the collection and cataloged separately as HV6535.C9 C66 1842.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection has not been arranged by an archivist. The materials are arranged in the order in which they were received from the seller.

did.unittitle: Cuban manuscript concerning the deposit of black cimarrones in prison
Cuban telegram on the persecution of trafficking and slavery, sent to Lieutenant Governor General Cardenas.
Cuban death certificate for a Chinese slave. It certifies that 'Estanislao, and Asiatic man' died at Charity Hospital of San Felipe y Santiago
La Protectora insurance policy on the life of a slave, showing the value of the premium and other details. From 'Comapnia General Cubana de Seguros Mutuos Sobre La Vida de Esclavos'
Certificate of burial for the newborn baby of a slave issued by the Church of the Holy Spirit in Havana. Another document issued by the Church of Monserrate for the same person
Document providing details summarizing slave expenditures
La Providencia insurance on a slave
Document of a marriage between slaves
Sobre Desobediencia Negro Cargador de Cadaveres
Identity paper for a female slave named 'Dominga'
Identity paper for a slave named Geronimo Ganga
Document granting freedom to a slave named Lelicia Frenyo
Document relating to payment for the burial of a slave
Document of the baptism of a Moreno named Francisco Herera
Freedom papers for a slave named Rosa Delgado
La Protectora insurance for a slave
Telegram concerning the persecution of the slave trade by the Lieutenant Governor of Cuba
Document Deposito Judicial de Esclavos
La Protectora slave insurance document
Stamped document for renting out a slave
Document for the deposit of a slave
La Providencia insurance for a slave
Identification paper for a slave named Guillermo
Report of the landing of "muzzle"
Document of marriage between two slaves belonging to a cavalry officer
Telegram on the persecution of the slave trade from Captain Pral
Document of a marriage between two slaves
La Providencia insurance for a slave
Document of marriage between a free Cuban slave and a free Venezuelan slave
Telegram relating to the slave trade
Group of five documents concerning the drowning of a slave in a well and details of the investigation and his burial
Two manuscripts documenting the death of a creole Moreno slave named Juan Delgado who drowned in a well
Document on the departure of a slave
Unidentified slave document, stamped

Chinese worker identification issued at 'Gobierno Politico de la Habana'. Left and right margins contain 9 articles which quote laws and regulations pertaining to 'cedulas' and the mid section contains information on the Chinese worker named Anselmo.
Contract for a Spanish slave from Palma in the Balearic Islands
Chinese slave contract from Guanajay and signed by a 28 year old from Canton
Chinese slave contract from Guanajay and signed by a 28 year old from Canton
Document of the death and burial of a Chinese worker
Chinese slave contract issued at the "Gobierno Politico de la Habana" and signed by a 28 year old
Chinese Slave identification "Cedula" Document issued at the "Gobierno Politico de la Habana"

Contract for a group of nine Spanish Slaves who were bounded and owned by this contract to one Saypa Hernandez. The third page contains a list of nine slaves included in this contract and five columns of data relating to each slave

Document issued by Captain General of Cuba Geronimo Valdes. It is a memorandum which informs of an illegal disembarkation of escaped slaves who later hid in a farm near Matanzas. Curiously Valdes states that this information was passed by the British.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Jerónimo Valdés (1784–1855) was a Spanish military figure and administrator. Born in Villarín, in Asturias, he participated in the battle of Ayacucho (1824), which was a defeat for the Spanish. He served as Viceroy of Navarre from 1833 to 1834 and also served as Minister of War. He fought on the Liberal (Isabeline) side in the First Carlist War. Valdés lost the Battle of Artaza (April 22, 1835). Valdés signed the Lord Eliot Convention soon after, regulating the treatment of prisoners during that war. He later served as captain-general of Valencia, and of Galicia, and served as governor of Cuba from 1841 to September 1843.

did.unittitle: Set of three documents written in Havana, Cuba dated February 1856 and totalling 8 pages. They deal with the sale of Sugar Mill 'La Constancia' including the slaves who worked at it. The file includes a 2 page list with 72 slaves to be included in the sale
Formal declaration by a priest/cura of a newly-baptised slave claiming freedom
Contract for a 28 year old Chinese slave from Canton
Cuban license for four Congo slaves to travel freely by train. It is signed by Governor Leopoldo O'Donnell
Cuban license for 36 slaves to travel freely by train to work on a sugar plantation. Each slave is mentioned by name. It is signed by Governor Leopoldo O'Donnell

Document written in Aranjuez, Spain. It was written at the Presidencia del Consejo de Ministerio de Ultramar and addressed to the Captain General of Cuba Domingo Dulce y Garay, who signed it upon receipt in Havana. The document discusses a fine of 30 pesos for owners of escaped slaves
Labor contract issued in Cuba for a Spanish laborer, a colono slave originally from Tenerife in the Canary Islands
Contract for group of 28 Spanish slaves, including the list of slaves. Written in Havana it is 3 pages of text. They were bonded and owned by this contract to one Saypa Hernandez
Puerto Rican slave registry document
Manuscript news bulletin on emancipated slave who was subsequently robbed
Manuscript of a baptismal declaration for two slaves (one from the Congo (aged 19) and the other (aged 12) from Macua (Macao?)). The slaves belong to a sub-lieutenant in the militia
Birth declaration. The mother is a 'free brown' woman
Slave declaration attesting to having a slave grandfather
Declaration of a baby born to two slaves, one from Congo and the other from Ganga
Request to have a newborn slave baptized. The mother is a slave and the father is unknown
Statement of baptism of a black Congo slave who belongs to the 'Commission of the Railroad'
Manuscript discussing captured slaves, one from the Congo
Declaration that the Sacred Sacrement is being given to a black native slave
Declaration of the birth of a child to a slave mother
Manuscript giving a name to a newly born slave child
Undated (1860s) statement that the God-Mother of the 'freed slaves' is Martina Abasi, of the nation 'Carabali'
Undated declaration of the birth of a baby of 'All Saints' who has 'free brown people' for godparents
Birth declaration of a baby born to a 'free brown' woman
Manuscript discussing the Sacred Sacrament of Baptism being given to a baby, daughter of a native slave
Havana birth declaration followed with a statement saying an emancipated Congo slave is in the care of a Colonel and has a slave Godfather
Manuscript news bulletin discussing a fight between two slaves from different owners, one sustaining a lesion
Birth declaration (Godmother is a slave)
Undated manuscript concerning two slaves that are listed but not appearing on a ships list
Declaration of the birth of a baby to two slave parents, one from the Congo and the other from Ganga
Four page manuscript concerning a fugitive from a train that is an emancipated Congo slave
Manuscript showing a chart on the emancipation of five slaves
Manumission document granting freedom to a slave boy who is less than a year old
Death certificate for a Chinese man named Domingo at the Hospital de Caridad de San Felipe y Santiago
Chart with details of five newly emancipated slaves (split down fold)
Manuscript concerning an fugitive emancipated slave that was found in a Havana 'deposito'
Manuscript statement of the birth of a baby born to 'all slaves'
Birth declaration for a 'brown woman'
Birth declaration (likely slaves)
Manuscript stating that a 'legitimate' child was born
Manuscript of a birth declaration (likely slave)
Ganga (Africa) off of ship 'Goleta'
Manuscript of priest presenting two criados for service
